abstract: Back-to-back deals on Wednesday to make Twitter’s steady stream of posts available to Microsoft and Google’s search engines may point to a potential new source of cash.
snippet: Back-to-back deals on Wednesday to make Twitter’s steady stream of posts available to Microsoft and Google’s search engines may point to a potential new source of cash.
lead_paragraph: Twitter gets 55 million monthly visitors, it has raised $155 million in venture capital, and it has generated intense interest from Hollywood to Iran. But it hasn’t earned much revenue and certainly no profit, Miguel Helft and Claire Cain Miller write in The New York Times.

headline.main: 2 Deals Hint at Revenue for Twitter

abstract: Whenever I review something that affects so many people, I can count on getting a lot of feedback — and I did, even though the review appeared only last night. Here’s a sampling, with my responses.
snippet: Whenever I review something that affects so many people, I can count on getting a lot of feedback — and I did, even though the review appeared only last night. Here’s a sampling, with my responses.
lead_paragraph: Today's a big day for Microsoft: Windows 7 comes out today. Virtually everybody considers it an improvement over Windows Vista. (Not everyone considers it an improvement on Windows XP, though, as you'll see in a moment.)

headline.main: Pogue Answers Reader Questions on Windows 7
headline.kicker: From the Desk of David Pogue
